edu.rit.m2mp
Interface Channel

All Known Implementing Classes:
IPMulticastChannel, IPUnicastChannel, LoggingChannel, M2MPRouterChannel
public interface Channel

Interface Channel specifies the interface for a channel in the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP). M2MP uses a channel to send messages to and receive messages from a particular underlying communication medium. Several M2MP channel implementations are provided, including:

  • Class M2MPRouterChannel — A channel that broadcasts to all M2MP instances within the same host. Requires the presence of a separate daemon process, class M2MPRouter, which can also send and receive M2MP messages on an external network if desired. See package edu.rit.m2mp.ip for further information.

  • Class IPMulticastChannel — A broadcast channel that sends messages to and receives messages from all hosts in a multicast group at a given IP multicast address and port. See package edu.rit.m2mp.ip for further information.

  • Class IPUnicastChannel — A point-to-point channel that sends messages to and receives messages from another host at a given IP unicast address and port. See package edu.rit.m2mp.ip for further information.

You can write your own M2MP channel implementation that uses a custom communication medium. You can then create an M2MP Protocol instance that uses your custom M2MP channel.

You can also set up a “channel pipeline” by hooking your M2MP Protocol instance up to a channel instance which is hooked up to another channel instance, and so on until you reach the final channel instance which hooks up to the underlying communication medium. Outgoing M2MP messages will traverse the channel pipeline in forward order, and incoming M2MP messages will traverse the channel pipeline in reverse order. This capability can be used, for example, to insert debug logging or other debug controls into the incoming and outgoing M2MP message streams. See class LoggingChannel for a sample implementation.

Requirements:

  • A Channel implementation must not pass up to its client on the incoming side any message packets that were sent on the channel's outgoing side.

  • A Channel implementation must be multiple thread safe. That is, multiple clients must be able to receive and transmit packets concurrently.

M2MP Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Method Summary
 ChannelAddress getAddress()
          Returns this channel’s address.
 ChannelAddress receivePacket(IncomingPacket thePacket)
          Receive the given M2MP packet via this channel.
 void transmitPacket(OutgoingPacket thePacket, ChannelAddress theDestination)
          Send the given M2MP packet via this channel to the given destination.
 

Method Detail

getAddress

public ChannelAddress getAddress()
Returns this channel’s address. This is the source channel address for packets transmitted via this channel.

receivePacket

public ChannelAddress receivePacket(IncomingPacket thePacket)
                             throws IOException
Receive the given M2MP packet via this channel. This method must:
  1. Receive the next packet from the communication medium, blocking until one is available.
  2. Fill in thePacket’s byte buffer with the contents of the received packet.
  3. Set thePacket’s buffer length to the correct value.
  4. Return the channel address of the entity that sent the packet.

Note: Some M2MP channel implementations always receive packets from the same place, such as a broadcast medium, and do not distinguish among sources. In that case the returned source address is typically this channel’s address. See the channel implementation documentation for further information.

Note: The returned packet must not be one that was sent via transmitPacket() on this channel.

Note: This method must not release thePacket. It is the caller’s responsibility to release thePacket.

Parameters:
thePacket - M2MP packet to be received.
Returns:
Source channel address of the entity that transmitted thePacket.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

transmitPacket

public void transmitPacket(OutgoingPacket thePacket,
                           ChannelAddress theDestination)
                    throws IOException
Send the given M2MP packet via this channel to the given destination. This method must:
  1. Extract the valid bytes out of thePacket’s byte buffer as determined by thePacket’s buffer length.
  2. Transmit those bytes to theDestination on the communication medium.

Note: Some M2MP channel implementations always send packets to the same place, such as a broadcast medium, and do not distinguish among destinations. In that case theDestination is ignored. See the channel implementation documentation for further information.

Note: This method must not release thePacket. It is the caller’s responsibility to release thePacket.

Parameters:
thePacket - M2MP packet to be sent to theDestination.
theDestination - Where to send thePacket.
Throws:
ClassCastException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theDestination is not of the proper type for this channel implementation.
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
